column4: ok i was in here a few ago with the problem with my grub. someone posted a tutorial and it isn't working. I am told to input "sudo grub-install --root-directory=/media/Ubuntu /dev/sda3" into terminal and yes the "Ubuntu" is my ubuntu partition as well as the "/dev/sda3" can someone help me?
You almost never want to install grub to a partition like /dev/sda3, always /dev/sda. And I prefer this guide using chroot: http://grub.enbug.org/Grub2LiveCdInstallGuide
whats the difference? and I thought I was supposed to install it to the sda3 since thats my ubuntu partition?
thats what the guide i was given said nyway

The practical difference is that http://grub.enbug.org/Grub2LiveCdInstallGuide is harder to get wrong accidentily. No, you need grub's boot sector to be in the mbr, the first sector of the disk, which is where the BIOS will look for it.
The guide you were given was wrong.
ok I am reading the link you gave me now. Thank you for your assistance. it was much needed
You're welcome.
ok I'm having trouble. It tells me to "fdisk" and find my linux partition which is /dev/sda3 and then to "sudo mount/dev/sda3/mnt" but I keep getting a command not fount error.
As I think you figured out, the spaces between arguments in a command are important.
yea i got it. in the tutorial it doesn't appear to be spaces but I tried it anyway and bam. thanks
ok but i'm still getting the same "cannot find a device for / (is /dev mounted?) and I mounted /dev
Did you run grub-install / grub-mkconfig from within the chroot?
I mounted my /dev/sda3 "the one that says linux" i mounted the /proc and /sys as instructed and sudo apt-get installe grub-pc when I attempt the mkconfig I get the error.
Did you run "sudo chroot /mnt/"?
What guide are you following?
see pm it is the ne you sent
anyway. I am following the link you posted. and nowhere does it say to chroot
And if you read the link (and what you PMd me) you will see: Your system should be ready to be chroot'd into, sudo chroot /mnt
Ok i don't know how i missed that. HOWEVER. after chrooting i still get the error  "sudo: unable to reslove host ubuntu/usr/sbin/grub-prob: error: cannot find a device for / (is /dev mounted?)
The commands after "sudo chroot /mnt/" need to be run in the same terminal. Follow the guide carefully and it will work.
